list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Refactor validators and improve error messaging
Updated validators for clarity and improved their error messages. Minor naming changes have also been made to improve readability and understanding of the code. PasswordValidatorTest has been updated as a part of these changes.

task.summary:
Add PasswordValidator with tests and Maven project configuration
Introduces PasswordValidator interface along with MinLengthValidator and MaxLengthValidator implementing classes. Also adds tests for password validation classes and Maven project configuration (pom.xml) file. Makes sure max length cannot be less than min length and vice versa. The commit extracts inputs like java.version, junit.jupiter.version and others to properties for flexible configuration.

Update password validators to handle digits
Added a new DigitValidator class to check for digit count in passwords. Adjusted ValidationResult to handle lists of errors instead of a single string message. Updated tests to cover these changes.

Add SpecialCharacterValidator with relevant tests
Implemented a SpecialCharacterValidator to check the minimum number of special characters in passwords. Updated the PasswordValidatorTest to provide test data and verify the functionality of special character validation.

Refactor PasswordValidatorTest to use shared manager
Removed individual declarations of the PasswordValidatorManager in each test method of PasswordValidatorTest. Now a shared validatorManager instance is used, which simplifies the code and reduces redundancy.

Add UpperCaseValidator and corresponding tests
Implemented a new UpperCaseValidator class to validate uppercase character count in passwords. Updated PasswordValidatorTest to include uppercase validation tests. This addition ensures passwords contain an adequate number of uppercase letters.

Remove unused constructor in PasswordValidationConflictException
The code removes an unused constructor from the PasswordValidationConflictException class that previously took a message and a Throwable as input parameters. Simplifying the class to only have necessary components.

Add LowerCaseValidator and corresponding tests
Added a new LowerCaseValidator class to validate the minimum number of lowercase letters in passwords. Updated the PasswordValidatorTest to include tests for this new validator. Made minor adjustments to the UpperCaseValidator test methodology for consistency.

Refactor validators and improve error messaging
Updated validators for clarity and improved their error messages. Minor naming changes have also been made to improve readability and understanding of the code. PasswordValidatorTest has been updated as a part of these changes.

MESSAGE.value:
Add PasswordValidator with tests and Maven project configuration
Introduces PasswordValidator interface along with MinLengthValidator and MaxLengthValidator implementing classes. Also adds tests for password validation classes and Maven project configuration (pom.xml) file. Makes sure max length cannot be less than min length and vice versa. The commit extracts inputs like java.version, junit.jupiter.version and others to properties for flexible configuration.

Refactor password validation and update tests
Enhanced password validators to account for the new digit requirement and updated ValidationResult to address this new feature. Added a new DigitValidator class to handle digit requirement in passwords. All changes are covered with updated and added tests.

Refactor password validators and enhance testing
Updated the password validation process to include digit requirements, introduced via the new DigitValidator class. Also incorporated changes to ValidationResult and updated the tests

Refactor password validators and enhance tests
Enhanced password validation by adding a requirement for digits through the implementation of a new class, DigitValidator. Also modified the ValidationResult to accommodate these changes and updated the associated tests to ensure these new requirements are covered.

Update password validators to handle digits
Added a new DigitValidator class to check for digit count in passwords. Adjusted ValidationResult to handle lists of errors instead of a single string message. Updated tests to cover these changes.

Add SpecialCharacterValidator with relevant tests
Implemented a SpecialCharacterValidator to check the minimum number of special characters in passwords. Updated the PasswordValidatorTest to provide test data and verify the functionality of special character validation.

Refactor PasswordValidatorTest to use shared manager
Removed individual declarations of the PasswordValidatorManager in each test method of PasswordValidatorTest. Now a shared validatorManager instance is used, which simplifies the code and reduces redundancy.

Add UpperCaseValidator and corresponding tests
Implemented a new UpperCaseValidator class to validate uppercase character count in passwords. Updated PasswordValidatorTest to include uppercase validation tests. This addition ensures passwords contain an adequate number of uppercase letters.

Remove overloaded constructor in PasswordValidationConflictException
Removed the constructor in PasswordValidationConflictException class that takes a message and a Throwable cause as parameters. This change simplifies the code by eliminating an unused constructor.

Remove unused constructor in PasswordValidationConflictException
The code removes an unused constructor from the PasswordValidationConflictException class that previously took a message and a Throwable as input parameters. Simplifying the class to only have necessary components.

Add LowerCaseValidator and modify UpperCaseValidator
Introduced a new class, LowerCaseValidator, to validate the minimum number of lowercase letters in passwords. Additionally, made modifications in the UpperCaseValidator and updated PasswordValidatorTest to include tests for lowercase validation.

Add LowerCaseValidator, update tests and refactor
Implemented a new class, LowerCaseValidator, to validate the minimum number of lowercase letters in passwords. Revised the PasswordValidatorTest to include corresponding tests for lowercase validation. Some minor alterations were also made in the UpperCaseValidator class.

Add LowerCaseValidator and corresponding tests
Added a new LowerCaseValidator class to validate the minimum number of lowercase letters in passwords. Updated the PasswordValidatorTest to include tests for this new validator. Made minor adjustments to the UpperCaseValidator test methodology for consistency.

Refactor validators and improve error messaging
Updated validators for clarity and improved their error messages. Minor naming changes have also been made to improve readability and understanding of the code. PasswordValidatorTest has been updated as a part of these changes.
